numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph shows the likelihood that a legacy applicant is admitted into an elite college.
2. The graph compares a legacy applicant with a non-legacy applicant who has the same qualifications.
3. The graph shows a student in the top 1 percent.
4. This student is more than 7 times as likely to be accepted to a school as a comparable non-legacy student.
6. Students who have wealthy parents are more likely to have legacy parents than other students.
7. Some colleges accept students based on financial status rather than merit.
8. I wonder how colleges can still accept students based on financial status rather than merit.
10. I wonder if legacy preference will be removed from the college admission process.
11. I am a student who applies to college.
13. Some applicants have a greater chance of getting into college solely because of wealth and legacy.
15. These applicants have a greater chance of getting into college than I have.
16. The headline is: The corruption among the elites.
